instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thunderbolt not working
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that is not working with my thunderbolt to hdmi adapter.
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_TBTBST</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP15V_TBT</SIGNAL>- 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBTLC</SIGNAL> - 3.3v

<TRANSISTOR>Q3080</TRANSISTOR> is showing 15v on both the gate and source. <TRANSISTOR>Q3005</TRANSISTOR> has 0v on the gate (<SIGNAL>TBT_A_HV_EN</SIGNAL>) which looks to be the reason why the gate of <TRANSISTOR>Q3080</TRANSISTOR> is so high.

Why is <SIGNAL>TBT_A_HV_EN</SIGNAL> not being created. Does my thunderbolt adapter need to be plugged into a tv for <SIGNAL>TBT_A_HV_EN</SIGNAL> to be present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thunderbolt not working
threads.message:
Give it back to customer or sell it first. I never fix these issues as 95% never use the thunderbolt anyway.
But yeah, corrosion somewhere in thunderbolt area is likely.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thunderbolt not working
threads.message:
This is a family members computer so I wanted to fix the thunderbolt so they can use it with that since the screen doesn't work.
I just got a crest ultrasonic so I will throw it in there and see that fixes it.
Assuming that you have an ultrasonic cleaner as well how long do you leave the board in?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thunderbolt not working
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thunderbolt not working
threads.message: The screen doesn't work for the same reason the thunderbolt doesn't work I bet. Need more history

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thunderbolt not working
threads.message:
Cleaned it up in the ultrasonic and still no thunderbolt.
The computer was dropped a few times. When the computer was working before it just shut off and never came back on the right side of the screen was messed up with lines going through it and you could only see the left side of the screen. The trackpad also wasn't working.
The only water damage area I could see before the ultrasonic cleaning was some blue spots around the <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thunderbolt not working
threads.message: Louis are you using alcohol or another things in ultrasonic cleaning machine?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thunderbolt not working
threads.message: 1 Gallon of distilled water and 103mL of Branson EC Fluid you can get from all-spec.com
